metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0265 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The redirect_stderr function in xnbd_common.c in xnbd-server and xndb-wrapper in xNBD 0.1.0 allow local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on /tmp/xnbd.log.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnbd-client - 0.2.0~rc2-hg1-abf8cc7a1ab0-2
xnbd-common - 0.2.0~rc2-hg1-abf8cc7a1ab0-2
xnbd-server - 0.2.0~rc2-hg1-abf8cc7a1ab0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xnbd package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.0~rc2-hg1-abf8cc7a1ab0-2').
